qas.question: How can natural predators benefit crops?

answers.text: reducing damage to crops, and are one alternative to the use of chemical agents such as pesticides

qas.question: How are predators beneficial to agriculture?
If removing an introduced species entirely isn't a posibility, what is the next best outcome?
Predators are used in conservation to reduce what type of species from the environment?
What is one way pesticides benefit crops?
What is one thing that can happen if you use pesticides?
What is the only thing that is possible when removing pests?
In what area are agricultural pests used for research?
What chemical agent is used to control introduced species?

context: Predators may be put to use in conservation efforts to control introduced species. Although the aim in this situation is to remove the <a3_0>introduced species<a3_0/> entirely, <a2_0><b6_0>keeping its abundance down<b6_0/><a2_0/> is often the only possibility. Predators from its natural range may be introduced to control populations, though in some cases this has little effect, and may even cause <b5_0>unforeseen problems<b5_0/>. Besides their use in <b7_0>conservation biology<b7_0/>, predators are also important for <a1_0>controlling pests<a1_0/> in agriculture. Natural predators are an environmentally friendly and sustainable way of <a0_0><b4_0>reducing damage<b4_0/> to crops, and are one alternative to the use of chemical agents such as <b8_0>pesticides<b8_0/><a0_0/>.
